notesStmt.note: Laurentius Franguellus (fl. until 1596): inscribed with his name, 1575 (folio 146v); see 78. Probably censored by Hippolite of Ferrara, Franciscan: inscribed 'Fra Hipp. Ferr 1601(?)' (active 1590-1609 in Cremona?) (folio 146v), see 18-19, 93. Giovanni Domenico Vistorini: inscribed 'Gio. Dom. Vistorini 1609' (folio 146v), see 85-87. Avram Shtern, inscribed in a note, folio 1r. A partly erased owner's note, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of ʿImanuʾel ben Shelomoh of Rome on Proverbs.

collation.p: Catchwords at the end of each quire, cut away for the most part.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Small Sefardi square and semi-cursive script, with visible Italian influences. Probably of 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600 covers. Rebound by BM/BL, with a new in-house bridge.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased of Rodd (?), perhaps Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): inscribed with a date of 13 April 1839, folio 1r.
